enWisdom: A person’s opinion is the gauge of his intelligence
The opinion of an intelligent person saves

Wisdom: أَلَا وَإِنَّ اللَّبِيبَ مَنِ اسْتَقْبَلَ وُجُوهَ الْآرَاءِ بِفِكْرٍ صَائِبٍ وَنَظَرَ فِي الْعَوَاقِبِ
enWisdom: Indeed, the intelligent person is one who considers the different [expressed] opinions with correct reasoning and considers the consequences [of matters]

Wisdom: حَقٌّ عَلَى الْعَاقِلِ أَنْ يُضِيفَ إِلَى رَأْيِهِ رَأْيَ الْعُقَلَاءِ وَيَضُمَّ إِلَى عِلْمِهِ عُلُومَ الْحُكَمَاءِ
enWisdom: It behooves the intelligent one to add the opinion of the intelligent people to his opinion and to merge the knowledge of the wise with his knowledge

Wisdom: إِذَا أَنْكَرْتَ مِنْ عَقْلِكَ شَيْئاً فَاقْتَدِ بِرَأْيِ عَاقِلٍ يُزِيلُ مَا أَنْكَرْتَهُ
enWisdom: When you are unable to understand something with your intellect then follow the opinion of the intelligent one and he will remove your ignorance about it

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنِ اتَّهَمَ رَأْيَهُ وَلَمْ يَثِقْ بِكُلِّ مَا تُسَوِّلُ لَهُ نَفْسُهُ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who suspects his [own] opinion and does not trust everything that his self makes decorous for him
